It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, typically growing in rocky or calcareous soils. The plant has basal leaves that are pinnately lobed and small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes. It is often found in disturbed habitats and can thrive in dry, sunny conditions. Noccaea valerianoides is known for its ability to tolerate poor soil conditions and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
